result.execSummary:
The defendant John L Alwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.
No entrance into any tavern or bar unless approved by Agent.
DNA sample must be provided and DNA surcharge must be paid within first 2 years of probation.
Comply with random drug tests.
Any conditions and assessments set up by proation.

timeConds.notes: If court obligations are paid in full ($315.13) by this time, jail sentence is stayed.

supervisions.notes: Def may have huber priviledges; allowed for work or treatment.

records.addlTxt: 10:15 Defendant John L Alwin in court with attorney William Michael Orth.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich and Orth have both reviewed the PSI and have no corrections. Froelich: bond by PSI and will honor that. S/W 3 years probation; Ct#1. 6 months jail on Ct#2. Orth gives argument for sentencing. Def addresses the court. Court: CT#2 senteces 6 months jail with no sentence credit; huber allowed for work release or treatment. Ct#1 orders: 3.5 years total -- 1.5 years of initial confinement and 2 years probation stays that orders 3 years probation consecutive to Ct#2 sentence.  condtions: comply with any conditions and assessement set up by parole.  No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.. No entrance into any taverns or bar unless approved by Agent. DNA sample and surcharge and court costs to be paid with first 2 years in probation. Comply with random drug screens. Appeal rights given to Def.  To start jail on or before July 27, 2015 at 9 am.
by DOC Agent T Gilby
Sentencing hearing at 05-26-2015 10:00 am

3:50 Defendant John L Alwin in court with attorney William Michael Orth.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan: will file an amended information charging 2 counts with Ct#1 and Ct#2 being a misdemeanor. Requests PSI. Binds to PSI recommendations. 3:51 court recesses. 3:59 Court resumes.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2 which will be contained in the amended information that will be filed by Atty OSullivan.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to Ct#1 and amended Ct#2 and dismisses Ct#3. Orders a PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: filed by William Orth
filed by William Orth

Defendant John L Alwin in Court with Attorney William M Orth.  DA Sean Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 1:09 p.m.  Set for Preliminary Hearing.  DA Froelich states Defendant is waiving Preliminary Hearing.  Court questions Defendant and advises of rights.  Atty. Orth agrees with waiver.  Court approves waiver and finds that Defendant has freely, voluntarily and knowingly waived right to Preliminary Hearing.  Court finds sufficient evidence that a felony was committed and binds Defendant over for trial.  Court questions Arraignment, DA Froelich informs re: Defense's request to set out.  Atty. Orth states that he will be filing NOR tomorrow, states possible conflict.  Court advises that substitution may be filed, states it should be in writing and cites WI Stat. 971.20.  Court reiterates to Defendant conditions of bond.
Preliminary hearing on June 10, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 19, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Def voluntarily waives his 20 day time limit to a preliminary hearing.
